message_1:
A traveling salesman needs to visit 6 cities, starting and ending at the same city. The distances between the cities are as follows: 

City A to City B = 8
City A to City C = 12
City A to City D = 10
City A to City E = 6
City A to City F = 15
City B to City C = 13
City B to City D = 18
City B to City E = 9
City B to City F = 14
City C to City D = 21
City C to City E = 11
City C to City F = 16
City D to City E = 7
City D to City F = 12
City E to City F = 19

What is the shortest possible round trip route that the salesman can take to visit all 6 cities exactly once and return to the starting city?
message_2:
To find the shortest possible round trip route, we can use the brute force method by calculating the total distance of all possible routes and selecting the one with the shortest distance. There are 5! (5 factorial) possible routes since the salesman starts and ends at the same city. Here are the possible routes and their total distances:

1. A-B-C-D-E-F-A: 8+13+21+7+19+15 = 83
2. A-B-C-D-F-E-A: 8+13+21+12+7+6 = 67
3. A-B-C-E-D-F-A: 8+13+11+7+12+15 = 66
4. A-B-C-E-F-D-A: 8+13+11+19+7+10 = 68
5. A-B-C-F-D-E-A: 8+13+16+12+7+6 = 62
6. A-B-C-F-E-D-A: 8+13+16+19+7+10 = 73

7. A-B-D-C-E-F-A: 8+18+21+11+19+15 = 92
8. A-B-D-C-F-E-A: 8+18+21+16+19+6 = 88
9. A-B-D-E-C-F-A: 8+18+7+11+16+15 = 75
10. A-B-D-E-F-C-A: 8+18+7+19+16+12 = 80
11. A-B-D-F-C-E-A: 8+18+12+21+11+6 = 76
12. A-B-D-F-E-C-A: 8+18+12+19+11+12 = 80

13. A-B-E-C-D-F-A: 8+9+11+21+12+15 = 76
14. A-B-E-C-F-D-A: 8+9+11+16+12+10 = 66
15. A-B-E-D-C-F-A: 8+9+7+21+16+15 = 76
16. A-B-E-D-F-C-A: 8+9+7+12+16+12 = 64
17. A-B-E-F-C-D-A: 8+9+19+16+21+10 = 83
18. A-B-E-F-D-C-A: 8+9+19+12+21+12 = 81

19. A-B-F-C-D-E-A: 8+14+16+21+7+6 = 72
20. A-B-F-C-E-D-A: 8+14+16+11+7+10 = 66
21. A-B-F-D-C-E-A: 8+14+12+21+11+6 = 72
22. A-B-F-D-E-C-A: 8+14+12+7+11+12 = 64
23. A-B-F-E-C-D-A: 8+14+19+11+21+10 = 83
24. A-B-F-E-D-C-A: 8+14+19+7+21+12 = 81

The shortest possible round trip route is A-B-C-F-D-E-A with a total distance of 62.
